snippet: The numbers for top aides to Chancellor Angela Merkel and her predecessors are on lists released by WikiLeaks, renewing questions about the United States’ spying on allies.
abstract: WikiLeaks releases American intelligence document containing telephone numbers of high-ranking German government officials, including Chancellor Angela Merkel’s top aides and senior figures from previous administrations; document, dating back to 1990s, adds to controversy surrounding United States intelligence service practices.
lead_paragraph: The numbers for top aides to Chancellor Angela Merkel and her predecessors are on lists released by WikiLeaks, renewing questions about the United States’ spying on allies.

headline.main: German Aides’ Phone Numbers Appear on U.S. Intelligence Documents
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Phone List Hints at Targets of U.S. Spying

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
